column9: :sacrificed  30 days.Transuranium content in organs and excreta (lung, trachea, liver, kidneys, spleen, muscles, skeleton, stomach, small and large intestines; urine and feces). Deterministic effects on respiratory physiology (respiration frequency, oxygen saturation of arterial and venous blood), on hemopoietic system (cellular composition of peripheral blood and red bone marrow), qualitative state of erythrocytes (cytometry, resistance, rate of maturing, duration of their circulation in the blood current), as well as erythropoietic activity of blood, blood coagulability (thromboelastogram), glycoproteins of blood serum, biochemistry of lung tissue. Late sequels: inflammatory, sclerotic, and neoplastic changes, mean life-span of animals.
